badge.name: Badge
badge.description: A badge is an indicator or label that provides additional information about a specific element or action. It's often used to highlight important details, provide contextual clues, or convey status updates.

button.name: Button
button.description: A button is a visual element that allows users to trigger an action or event with a single click. It's often used for calls-to-action, navigation, or form submission.

Divider.name: Test
Divider.description: A divider is a visual element used to separate content or sections within a layout. It can be used to create visual hierarchy, emphasize important information, or improve readability.

ui-setup-component-search.name: UI setup component search
ui-setup-component-search.description: A UI setup component search is a feature that allows users to quickly find and access specific components or elements within a design system.

button-group.name: Button Group
button-group.description: A button group is a collection of buttons that are grouped together to perform related actions. It's often used for navigation, form submission, or other tasks.

button-close.name: Button close
button-close.description: A button close is a visual element that allows users to dismiss or close a modal, overlay, or other interactive elements.

button-with-icon-only.name: Button with icon only
button-with-icon-only.description: A button with icon only is a visual element that uses an icon as the primary visual cue, without any text or other content.

social-button.name: Social button
social-button.description: A social button is a visual element that allows users to share content or interact with social media platforms directly from the application.

store-badges.name: Store badges
store-badges.description: Store badges are visual elements used to represent specific achievements, milestones, or accomplishments within a store or marketplace.

checkbox.name: Checkbox
checkbox.description: A checkbox is an interactive element that allows users to select one or more options from a list. It's often used for form submission, filtering, or other tasks.

checkbox-label.name: Checkbox label
checkbox-label.description: A checkbox label is the text that accompanies a checkbox, providing context and clarity for users. It's often used to describe the option being selected.

content-frames.name: Content Frames
content-frames.description: Content frames are visual elements that group related content together, creating a clear and organized layout. They can be used to emphasize important information or create visual hierarchy.

content-slots.name: Content Slots
content-slots.description: Content slots are areas within a design where content can be inserted. They provide a flexible and modular way to display different types of content.

content-header.name: Content Header
content-header.description: A content header is a visual element that provides context and information about the content within a section or page. It can include titles, subtitles, or other metadata.

content-slot.name: Content Slot
content-slot.description: A content slot is an area within a design where specific types of content can be inserted. It provides a flexible and modular way to display different types of content.

divider.name: Divider
divider.description: A divider is a visual element used to separate content or sections within a layout. It can be used to create visual hierarchy, emphasize important information, or improve readability.

drop-down-box.name: Drop-Down Box
drop-down-box.description: A drop-down box is an interactive element that allows users to select one option from a list. It's often used for form submission, filtering, or other tasks.

drop-down-menu.name: Drop-Down Menu
drop-down-menu.description: A drop-down menu is an interactive element that allows users to select one option from a list. It's often used for form submission, filtering, or other tasks.

empty-state.name: Empty state
empty-state.description: An empty state is a visual representation of an interface when there is no content to display. It can be used to provide context, instructions, or entertainment.

empty-state-graphic.name: Empty state graphic
empty-state-graphic.description: An empty state graphic is a visual representation of an interface when there is no content to display. It can be used to provide context, instructions, or entertainment.

icons.name: Icons
icons.description: An icon is a small visual representation of an object, concept, or action. It's often used to provide visual cues, convey meaning, or create visual hierarchy.

info-card.name: Info card
info-card.description: An info card is a visual element that provides information about an object, concept, or action. It can include text, images, or other metadata.

content---inbox---classic.name: Content / Inbox / Classic
content---inbox---classic.description: A content inbox is a visual element that displays a list of messages, notifications, or other items. It's often used for communication, reminders, or alerts.

content---inbox---compact.name: Content / Inbox / Compact
content---inbox---compact.description: A content inbox is a visual element that displays a list of messages, notifications, or other items. It's often used for communication, reminders, or alerts.

mail-navigation-list-item.name: Mail navigation list item
mail-navigation-list-item.description: A mail navigation list item is a visual element that represents an individual message, notification, or other item within a content inbox.

check-list-item.name: Check list item
check-list-item.description: A check list item is an interactive element that allows users to select one option from a list. It's often used for form submission, filtering, or other tasks.

class-list-item.name: Class list item
class-list-item.description: A class list item is an interactive element that allows users to select one option from a list. It's often used for form submission, filtering, or other tasks.

gglogo.name: GGLOGO
gglogo.description: The GG logo is a visual representation of the company's identity. It can be used as a standalone element or in conjunction with other design elements.

gg_logo_icon.name: GG_LOGO_ICON
gg_logo_icon.description: The GG logo icon is a visual representation of the company's identity. It can be used as a standalone element or in conjunction with other design elements.

gg_logo_mark.name: GG_LOGO_MARK
gg_logo_mark.description: The GG logo mark is a visual representation of the company's identity. It can be used as a standalone element or in conjunction with other design elements.

modal-header.name: Modal header
modal-header.description: A modal header is a visual element that provides context and information about the content within a modal window. It can include titles, subtitles, or other metadata.

modal-actions.name: Modal actions
modal-actions.description: Modal actions are visual elements that allow users to interact with the content within a modal window. They can include buttons, links, or other interactive elements.

pagination.name: Pagination
pagination.description: A pagination is an interactive element that allows users to navigate between different pages of content. It can include buttons, links, or other interactive elements.

pagination-dots.name: Pagination dots
pagination-dots.description: A pagination dot is an interactive element that allows users to navigate between different pages of content. It's often used in conjunction with other design elements, such as buttons or links.

linear-loader.name: Linear loader
linear-loader.description: A linear loader is an animated visual element that provides feedback to the user while a task is being performed. It can be used for loading, processing, or other tasks.

linear-loader-(looping).name: Linear loader (looping)
linear-loader-(looping).description: A linear loader (looping) is an animated visual element that provides feedback to the user while a task is being performed. It can be used for loading, processing, or other tasks.

radial-loader.name: Radial loader
radial-loader.description: A radial loader is an animated visual element that provides feedback to the user while a task is being performed. It can be used for loading, processing, or other tasks.

radial-loader-(looping).name: Radial loader (looping)
radial-loader-(looping).description: A radial loader (looping) is an animated visual element that provides feedback to the user while a task is being performed. It can be used for loading, processing, or other tasks.

radio-button.name: Radio Button
radio-button.description: A radio button is an interactive element that allows users to select one option from a list. It's often used for form submission, filtering, or other tasks.

radio-button-group.name: Radio Button Group
radio-button-group.description: A radio button group is an interactive element that allows users to select one option from a list. It's often used for form submission, filtering, or other tasks.

toggle-switch.name: Toggle switch
toggle-switch.description: A toggle switch is an interactive element that allows users to select one option from a list. It's often used for form submission, filtering, or other tasks.

toggle-label.name: Toggle label
toggle-label.description: A toggle label is the text that accompanies a toggle switch, providing context and clarity for users. It's often used to describe the option being selected.

horizontal-tabs.name: Horizontal tabs
horizontal-tabs.description: Horizontal tabs are an interactive element that allows users to navigate between different sections of content. It's often used for navigation, filtering, or other tasks.

vertical-tabs.name: Vertical tabs
vertical-tabs.description: Vertical tabs are an interactive element that allows users to navigate between different sections of content. It's often used for navigation, filtering, or other tasks.

tab-button.name: Tab button
tab-button.description: A tab button is an interactive element that allows users to navigate between different sections of content. It's often used for navigation, filtering, or other tasks.

accordion.name: Accordion
accordion.description: An accordion is an interactive element that allows users to expand and collapse sections of content. It's often used for navigation, filtering, or other tasks.

accordion-item.name: Accordion item
accordion-item.description: An accordion item is a section of content within an accordion that can be expanded and collapsed. It's often used for navigation, filtering, or other tasks.

card-header.name: Card header
card-header.description: A card header is a visual element that provides context and information about the content within a card. It can include titles, subtitles, or other metadata.

page-header.name: Page header
page-header.description: A page header is a visual element that provides context and information about the content within a page. It can include titles, subtitles, or other metadata.

section-header.name: Section header
section-header.description: A section header is a visual element that provides context and information about the content within a section. It can include titles, subtitles, or other metadata.

login-sections.name: Login sections
login-sections.description: A login section is an interactive element that allows users to log in to a system. It can include forms, buttons, or other interactive elements.

signup-sections.name: Signup sections
signup-sections.description: A signup section is an interactive element that allows users to sign up for a system. It can include forms, buttons, or other interactive elements.

avatar.name: Avatar
avatar.description: An avatar is a visual representation of a user's identity or profile. It can be used to represent the user in various contexts, such as chat windows or profiles.

avatar-labeled.name: Avatar labeled
avatar-labeled.description: An avatar labeled is a visual representation of a user's identity or profile that includes additional information, such as name or email address.

avatar-stack.name: Avatar stack
avatar-stack.description: An avatar stack is an interactive element that allows users to view multiple avatars in a compact format. It's often used for displaying profiles or contact information.
